result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Request for release/modification/change in sentence. Request bond modification with attachments, filed by DE. olg       Per SRN, C: DA and DE atty. olg

04:05 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant James Daniel Burton in court, in custody.  Attorney Shirlene Renee Perrin in court for James Daniel Burton.  Prosecuting attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for the State of Wisconsin. Includes 22CF587 and 22CF597- ARGN for both files.  As to 22CF587- Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  As to 22CF597- Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  To both files, Atty Perrin waives reading.  NG pleas entered on all counts. Atty Perrin demand's speedy trial.  FPT is cut off for negotiations.  Adjourned at 4:09 PM. bph
Jury trial scheduled for December 21, 2022 at 08:00 am.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Final pre-trial on November 21, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Jury trial on December 21, 2022 at 08:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for James Daniel Burton
Current: 528 Pearl St, River Falls, WI 54022   (Effective: 10-04-2022)
Prior:
Filed by ADA Becker. arc   e: Atty Perrin. arc
NOH (PH) returned by PO. Return to sender. Not deliverable as addressed. Unable to forward. olg

3:04 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant James Daniel Burton in court, in custody.  Attorney Shirlene Renee Perrin in court for James Daniel Burton.  Prosecuting attorney Erica Ellenwood in court for the State of Wisconsin. Includes 22CF587 & 22CF597, both files set for PH.   As to 22CF587- S/T of Officer Jordan Hemker of RFPD. Direct by ADA Ellenwood.  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. As to 22CF597- S/T of Sgt Joseph Bradac of SCSO. Direct by ADA Ellenwood. Cross by Atty Perrin. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. Bond continues.  Adjourned at 4:11 PM. bph
Arraignment scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 03:45 pm.
Arraignment on October 4, 2022 at 03:45 pm.

11:36 AM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant James Daniel Burton in court, in custody.  Attorney Shirlene Renee Perrin in court for James Daniel Burton.  Prosecuting attorney Erica Ellenwood in court for the State of Wisconsin. Includes 22CF597 & 22CF587.  Court notes PH needs to be held.  Court continues to find good cause to push PH out since Atty Perrin was just appointed.  DE is on PO hold.  Adjourned at 11:37 AM. bph
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on September 29, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
filed by Jennifer G. requesting to have address on file removed from 22CF587 & 22CF597.  Jennifer states DE does not live at that address and has not since end of July.  To rg 9/13/22. bph
filed by Travis Satorius; hereby appointing Atty Perrin. kma

9:26 AM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant James Daniel Burton in court.  Prosecuting attorney Brian Thomas Smestad in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Abrianna Dolfi in court for James Daniel Burton. Includes 22CF587 & 22CF597.  Court reviews file. Atty Dolfi states there is a conflict in the office, unsure of status at this point.  DE is on PO hold. PD's office to find someone to represent DE.  Adjourned at 9:41 AM. bph
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 11:15 am.
Pre-trial conference on September 15, 2022 at 11:15 am.
Pre-trial/scheduling conference on September 8, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Includes 22CF597 & 22CF587

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to submit to random drug testing [or/and] random ETG testing at least THREE times per week. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.

Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license or ignition interlock device.

1:01 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant James Daniel Burton in court, in custody.  Attorney Stephanie Kay Schmidt in court for James Daniel Burton.  Prosecuting attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for the State of Wisconsin. Includes 22CF597 (INIT) and 22CF587 (STC).  Court reviews file and notes DE appeared earlier today but doesn't have an Attorney appointed from PD's office at this time.  As to 22CF597- Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  Court orders bond and schedules PSC. bph
Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 09:30 am.

11:34 AM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant James Daniel Burton in court.  Prosecuting attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for the State of Wisconsin. Set for PH. Court reviews file and notes Officer here in person. DE is still on PO hold.  ADA Becker states there is another matter DE is appearing on at 1:00 today.  Court will schedule those matters together so PH can be held at one time.  Adjourned at 11:58 AM. bph

I further understand that I am required to submit to random drug testing [or/and] random ETG testing at least THREE times per week. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.

1:40 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Lindabaur. Prosecuting attorney Michael Becker appeared.  Jeremiah Harrelson appeared for Defendant for today. Atty Harrelson didn't get an opportunity to meet with DE in the jail and doesn't know if DE qualifies for PD. DE currently doesn't have a mailing address. DE confirms DOB. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Waive reading. PO hold. Bond argument; bond ordered. Court sets BBH.  gll
